plugins.name: Color Variables Style Guide Generator
plugins.description:
This plugin enables you to generate a color style guide based on your local variables.

Tailored for teams following the Tailwind Design system and its naming convention (e.g., "Blue/500"), the generator displays styles in sections according to the defined groups in the variables panel, with subgroups if applicable.


For each color, a swatch is generated. If the collection includes modes, these will be displayed alongside the color swatches, showing the hex code or referenced variable for each mode. The generator traces references to display the hex code of the original variable. However, if a referenced variable includes modes, it will simply display the variable name, as determining the hex code in such cases is not feasible.


Enjoy and looking forward to your feedback.

accepted.name: novu
accepted.description: Web and Software Agency from Basel, Bern, and Zurich

plugins.tagline: Automatically generate color style guides based on your defined variables including modes

plugins.name: No Numbers
plugins.description:
Get rid of default numbers in layer names. Why keep Rectangle 164 if it's just a Rectangle?


How to use

Just run it from the Quick Actions or Plugin menu. The plugin will remove default numbers from every layer on the page.

Alternatively, you can select some layers. The plugin will rename them and their children (if any).


How it works

It turns default layer names like Rectangle 420 or Frame 69 to simple Rectangle or Frame. It will beautify layers mess and help to keep your files clean and pretty. It's kinda fast, average 250 layers per second.


The plugin won't affect any other layer names. It works with frames, groups, slices and any vector objects as well.


Problem? Idea? Kind words?

I accept feature suggestions and ideas to improve the plugin. No need to mess with locked layers? Rename on all pages at once? Useful exceptions? If you have any ideas or issues, let me know in the comments.


Or you can contact me via e-mail at nick.denq@gmail.com and Telegram.

This project is open sourced on Github.


<3

accepted.name: Nick Qurle
accepted.description:
freestyle ux/ui designer who knows how code works

doing stuff at figma.com/@vk

plugins.tagline: Get rid of numbers in layer names. Frame 1607 is just a Frame

plugins.name: Elevation Scale
plugins.description:
Create shadow systems and effect styles with your choice of steps from a custom function.


Usage

  1. Run the plugin and click the Create a new elevation scale button
  2. Select the elevation scale frame
  3. Adjust the settings to your liking


Changes are automatically applied and saved.


Steps

Steps are the amount of elevations/shadows you want to create. For example steps:2 will create two shadows each with all the layers you specify.


Effect Styles

To automatically create & update effect styles enable the Sync Styles option. You can optionally provide a style name that will be used to create the effect styles. If you add a # to the name it will be replaced with the current step. A ## will result in a 0 prefixed number if below 10.

// Example style name with #
Elevation / Level # // Elevation / Level 0, Elevation / Level 1, ...

// Example style name with ##
Elevation / ##dp // Elevation / 00dp, Elevation / 01dp, ..., Elevation / 12dp


Properties

  • Shadow type: Either dropshadow or innershadow
  • x: The x offset of the shadow. # is replaced by the current step. E.g. .5*#
  • y: The y offset of the shadow. # is replaced by the current step. E.g. 2+#
  • blur: The shadows blur radius. # is replaced by the current step. E.g. (1+#)*4
  • spread: The shadows spread. # is replaced by the current step. E.g. #/.5
  • color: a 6-digit hex color code between 000000 and FFFFFF
  • opacity: The opacity for the color. # is replaced by the current step. E.g. 10+# if # = 1 -> 11%


Adding Layers

An elevation step consists of one or more elevation layers (each `layer` is an effect e.g. a dropshadow or innershadow). 

Each layer you add will be present on each step.

To add a new layer, click the "Add layer" button below the list of layers.

To delete a layer click the trash can icon next to the layer name. (You can not delete the last layer)


Layer names are purely for your organization of the different layers and have no effect on the elevations or the names.


Bug reports, PRs & feature requests

If you find a bug or want to help by suggestion or even developing a feature, please reach out on the github project page: https://github.com/lukasoppermann/elevation-scale/issues

accepted.name: Lukas Oppermann

plugins.name: Toolabs Design System Manager
plugins.description:
â¦ Design Tokens, Theme Management and more...


Define or update design tokens in one single panel, right from Figma.

And, immediately see the changes cascading through your Figma design.


â¦ Manage Figma Styles with DSM Plugin


Selected Figma items are grouped by their styles and listed in the Selection Tab of the plugin.

For each distinct style group, you can apply following actions to Figma items having this style :

â¥ Create and attach to New Token for each single style

â¥ Tokenize All styles

â¥ Select and attach to an Existing Token

Or

â¥ Select,

â¥ Delete,

â¥ Zoom to selected items with this style.


â¦ Use Real Content in your designs


You can easily populate your design with real data from Content tab of DSM plugin.


When you click a data field on the plugin, all selected Figma layer items will be filled with relevant text or image data. You can also create custom data collections to be used as real content.


â¦ Document your Design System


Build your design system documents with an easy to use editor like Medium.com. Enhanced with design systems related customizable widgets!


â¦ Design to Code


â¥ Programmatically access to design tokens from GraphQL API, or

â¥ Use Export Widgets in documentation to export design tokens in various formats, e.g. CSS, Less, Sass, JSON, YAML, Js, Swift or Android.


Learn more at :

â¥ https://www.toolabs.com/plugins/figma/


ð  Known Issues : Figma Plugin API does not allow to modify Team Library styles, because of this limitation, DSM design tokens can not be synced with team library styles.

plugins.name: Lo-Fier | convert to wireframe
plugins.description:
Lo-Fier: Effortless Wireframe Transformation


Transform your polished designs into quick, low-fidelity wireframes with a single click using Lo-Fier. Perfect for rapid prototyping and initial design feedback, this plugin streamlines your workflow by converting text into clean, customizable rectangles and replacing images with a neutral grey background or a color of your choice.


Key Features:


  1. One-Click Conversion: Instantly turn your detailed designs into simplified wireframes.
  2. Customizable Rectangles: Adjust the corner radius of the rectangles to match your preferred style.
  3. Flexible Color Options: Choose between the default color or set your own custom color for the wireframes and backgrounds.
  4. Image Removal: Effortlessly replace images with a grey background or any color you select.

Lo-Fier is designed to help you iterate faster and communicate ideas more clearly during the design process. Simplify your wireframing with ease and efficiency!
plugins.tagline: Turn your Hi-Fi to Lo-Fi with only one click

plugins.name: Icons Toolbox
plugins.description:
Set of tools to save you from redoing the same thing over and over again while designing or using your favorite icons.


Tools:

  • Save frame sizes and icons max-width preferences in a form of a button to have for future use.

save as many preferences as you like and delete unused ones.

  • Flatten multiple selected icons. 
  • Flatten all icons on a page.
  • Duplicate multiple selected icons and rescale them to different sizes.


All of the above with a press of a button!!!


Last but not least, you have the option to preserve the stroke width in each resize or, you can let the plugin do the computations for you and change the weight according to the scaling ratio.

How to use:

1. Copy an image or image URL to your clipboard.
2. Select one or more layers on the canvas.
3. Run "Paste to Fill".
4. Press âV (Mac) or Ctrl + V (Windows) to paste the image as a fill.

* If you have clicked outside the plugin window after launching the plugin, please make sure to click the window again before pasting.

plugins.name: Svg Code Copy
plugins.description:
Say sayonara to the boring task of exporting graphics as SVGs and opening them in a text editor to get the SVG code.


With this plugin, the SVG code is just a click away! You simply select the element you want, hit a button, and voila: your SVG code is ready for use


How to use:


  1. Select the desired vector graphic, fram group or text layer in Figma.
  2. Click "Generate SVG code". The SVG code appears in the plugin textarea.
  3. Optional: Check 'Remove fill attributes' to remove all fill attributes. Check 'Set width & height to 100%' to make dimensions flexible.
  4. Click "Copy to Clipboard" to copy the SVG code.


Note: The plugin doesn't support images.
plugins.tagline: SVG code to clipboard in a blink of an eye!

plugins.name: Copy and Paste Text
plugins.description:
Figma plugin to copy & paste plain text (without text styles) from selected layers.


# Usage

## Copy Text

Select the Text Objects you want to copy and run `Copy Text`.

And then copied texts to clipboard.

(Not support selected range of text)


## Paste Text

Select the Text Objects you want to paste and run `Paste Text`

If you want to paste in cursor position, you should run default paste (âV) with unformmated text (you will get it with `Copy Text` plugin command !!).


# Keyboard Shortcut (for Mac Desktop App)

About keyboard shortcut setting is wrriten on github repository: https://github.com/kudakurage/figma-copy-and-paste-text


# Supported Object

- Text

- Group

- Frame

- Component

- Instance


# Issues

I know that plugin command doesn't work on browser app. (under consideration how to fix..)

accepted.name: Kaz Motoyama @kudakurage
accepted.description: Product Manager / Designer at Puddle Sketch. Spinners Inc. co-founder.

plugins.name: Chatbot Markup
plugins.description:
This plugin will assist you in the chatbot development process. It provides an automate formatting process of texts components on Figma, converting setences written with italics or bold to costumized markup notations for developers. You can also choose form predefined rules for channels such as whatsapp and HTML notation.


To use, click on any text element with italics or bold and watch the markup occur. Currently this plugin allows three types of configurations:


1) WhatsApp Markup

- Italic: _..._ 

- Bold: *...*


2) HTML Markup

- Italic: <i>...</i>

- Bold: <b>...</b>


3) Customized Markup

- Italic: {{iS}}...{{iE}}

- Bold: {{bS}}...{{bE}}


Made with â¥ in Brazil.

plugins.name: Figchat
plugins.description:
Talk to your teammates directly inside a Figma frame. Thereâs no third-party servers or setup required, simply select the frame you want to comment on and chat away. Figchat renders all your comments as items within Figma itself.


Um... Figma already has a commenting tool?


It does! And it works well. Figchat was created to provide something a little different:


  • A chat based UI for your conversations
  • Use in a silent review setting to collate everyones thoughts in an organized manner
  • Add your own notes quickly when reviewing with your teammates or when thinking through a design
  • Have multiple different conversations about different frames simultaneously
  • View all comments in situ with the work, no need to dig into menus or closed comments
  • No third-party hosting of your comments, no tracking of your actions. Everything remains in Figma
  • Dark mode chats... just for kicks

plugins.name: Jony Eye: Figma Design Assistant
plugins.description:
Hey there! We're a team of designers tired of spending hours checking our frames. So we created Jony Eye - it's like an art director, but virtual. It's a Figma plugin that helps to make your designs flawless and eye-catching. Say goodbye to mind-numbing manual checks! It's time to revolutionize your design process and simplify workflow.


Jony Eye helps with:


  1. Identifying accidentally used fonts.
  2. Finding style-related errors
  3. Detection problems in the file.


How it works:


â¦ Install the Jony Eye plugin on your Figma Desktop version.

â¦ Pick the work frame you want to inspect and customize the types of errors you're itching to find, or go all out and scan for everything.

â¦ Sit back, relax, and let Jony Eye do its magic. It'll serve up a sweet list of detected flaws, with juicy descriptions and killer suggestions to improve things.

â¦ Zoom in on any listed error and be transported directly to the exact element within your work frame where the glitch went down.


So, what the heck are you waiting for? Give Jony Eye and witness firsthand how it can supercharge your design game.


We're all ears regarding your feedback, ideas, and mind-blowing insights. Please email us at pr@halo-lab.team with any questions or thoughts.
plugins.tagline: Find Major UX/UI Errors in Your File

plugins.name: HyperCrop Batch Image Resizer
plugins.description:
Documentation & Video Tutorials


For plugin documentation and step by step video tutorials, please visit https://docs.hypermatic.com/hypercrop


Questions & Support


HyperCrop is still a baby panda, so if you notice any bugs or have any questions about the plugin, please get in touch directly via https://hypermatic.com/contact and we'll help you troubleshoot and resolve them as quickly as possible.


Security


HyperCrop is designed to be privacy and security focused â for details about security and how the plugin works, please visit https://docs.hypermatic.com/hypercrop/security


Features


  1. Insanely simple batch cropping multiple images to multiple sizes.
  2. High precision manual crop tool for individual image cropping.
  3. Automatic content aware and face detection smart crop features.
  4. Specify the anchor focal point per image (eg. "Bottom/Center")
  5. Includes quick size presets for social networks, platforms and devices.
  6. Add your own custom crop sizes to the crop presets library, per Figma page.
  7. Crop sizes, selections and options automatically saved in between uses.
  8. Export to JPG/PNG with optional image compression for smaller file sizes.
  9. Custom, dynamic filenames and subfolders (eg. "#{name}/#{width}x#{height}).


Itâs time to put your image cropping and resizing on cruise control.

From manually cropping individual images, to batch cropping hundreds of images into dozens of sizes; we got you covered.


The simplest image batching youâve ever used.

Terrifying flashbacks of doing this in Photoshop are history. Just add the sizes you need (or select from our platform presets), select your images, and you're ready to put your crops on autopilot.


Manually crop and resize individual images with ultimate precision.

For those who accept no substitute for their own hand crafted crops; fear not, you can tweak the crops of your Figma images to your heart's content, with the beautiful, seamless manual crop feature.


Never search Google for âSocial Media Sizesâ again.

With quick presets, you can easily add multiple sizes for popular platforms like Facebook, Google Ads, Instagram, LinkedIn, Pinterest, Snapchat, Twitch, Twitter, YouTube and more!


Customised, dynamic image filenames and subfolders.

Automatically save your exported images into dynamic, customisable folder structures with filenames suited to you, your team or your clients.


Built-in content aware and face detection cropping.

For tricky images being resized into weird sizes, try using the content aware and face detection options for better crops.


HyperCrop Pro


10 free trials of HyperCrop Pro are included with the free version, and if you're a casual user, you can continue using the free version of HyperCrop forever.


If you're a power user, you can optionally upgrade to continue using all the extra features that are only available in the pro version of HyperCrop.


To learn more about HyperCrop Pro, please visit https://www.hypermatic.com/hypercrop/#pro

accepted.name: Hypermatic
accepted.description: Never send a human to do a machine's job. Spend less time crying, and more time designing.

plugins.tagline: The fastest way to batch crop/resize multiple images to multiple sizes from Figma

plugins.name: Remove Auto Layout Faster
plugins.description:
Or RALF for short, will remove any instance of Auto Layout found in the selected frames and all their children frames.

â¤ Remove Auto Layout Faster? Buy me a coffee!


How to use RALF â

  1. Select one or more layers;
  2. Run plugin;
  3. RALF will automatically add to the selection all nested Frames and Main Components;
  4. The plugin will remove all instances of Auto Layout from that selection.


Use Cases ð¨

  • Clearing up one or more Frames of several Auto Layout instances;
  • Starting over a complex construction of Auto Layout;
  • Prep a file to apply the latest Auto Layout update.
  • Anything else you find it useful for!


In Detail ð

  • Any type of layers can be selected, the plugin will then look for Frames or Main Components within that selection;
  • A Main Component will have its Auto Layout removed, an Instance will not;
  • The operation time will increase if a large amount of Frames or Main Components is selected, and/or found within the user selection;
  • The plugin will measure the success of the operation by showing how many instances of Auto Layout were removed.
plugins.tagline: Remove any instance of Auto Layout found in the selected frames and all their children frames

Tired of creating tons of export settings for multiple layers, every single time? This is the plugin for you.


Features

  • Create, save, and apply custom Export Settings presets.
  • Preloaded with default export settings for Web, iOS, Android, Flutter, and PWA. All configured with the proper specs for size and density.
  • Access your Export Settings from any file or project.
  • Apply custom Export Settings to multiple layers in batch.


Default Presets 

â¢ Android - Assets (JPG or PNG)
  [ldpi, mdpi, hdpi, xhdpi, xxhdpi]

â¢ Flutter - Assets (JPG or PNG)
  [1x, 1.5x, 2x, 3x, 4x]

â¢ Generic (PDF | SVG)

â¢ iOS App Icon (PNG)
  [All Supported Sizes, 1x, 2x, 3x]
  
â¢ iOS Artwork (JPG or PNG)
  [1x, 2x, 3x]

â¢ PWA App Icon (PNG)
  [All Supported Sizes, from 72 to 512]
  
â¢ Web Favicon (PNG)
  [32, 128, 152, 167, 180, 192, 196]

â¢ Web Retina (JPG or PNG)
  [1x, 2x]

Usage


Apply a custom preset

  1. Select one or more layers on the canvas.
  2. Open the plugin and click a preset to apply the corresponding export settings.


Create a custom preset

  1. Select a layer with the desired export setting from your canvas.
  2. Open the plugin a name to the preset using the input field on the Toolbar.
  3. Press the + button to add the preset.


Update an existing preset

  1. Select a layer with the new export setting from your canvas.
  2. Type down the exact name of the preset that you want to update.
  3. Press the + button to update the preset.

plugins.name: AI Image Generator - Text to Image Online
plugins.description:
Whether you're a blogger, social media marketer, or just looking to add some creativity to your personal projects, our AI-powered tool will help you create eye-catching images in seconds.


Turn a single line of text into a beautiful, high-resolution image in seconds. Our image generator is easy to use and perfect for any project.


Choose from several output styles: photos, paintings, pencil drawings, 3D graphics, icons, abstract art, and more. Let's create stunning, one of a kind images instantly.


Use cases

A good picture is worth a thousand words. AI generated images have the ability to turn a thousand words into a million. Whether youâre writing an article, building a webpage, or running an ad campaign, build up an instant library of creatives and resources to fully express yourself.


â¤Marketers

Distinguish yourself from the competition with one of a kind pictures that speak to the heart of your audience. Supercharge your marketing collateral ideas.


â¤Artists and designers

Inspire and fuel creativity. Use AI generated images to springboard your ideas and kickstart the creation process. Don't start from a blank canvas.


â¤Entrepreneurs

Unlock and express the ideas you have without huge budgets. Build your brand, spread the word and communicate your message with unique images for your website or product.

â¤Be bold

Put your creativity to the test and try anything you dream of! Craft impossible promptsâyouâll be surprised every time. The possibilities are endless.

â¤Keep it simple

The perfect prompt is all about simplicity. Donât over-explain or use unnecessary words. Focus on taking small steps and including the most valuable details in your description.

plugins.name: Truncate Lines
plugins.description:
Limit the number of lines of text that appear in your designs.


Select one or more blocks of text, set the number lines you need, then just click apply.


If you select text that is part of a component or instance you can choose to apply it to the selection only or apply across all the instances to keep them consistent.


If you need the original text back just press reset and your original text will reappear.


Hopefully this plugin will become redundant in the near future but in the meantime you can save yourself a bit of time.


A guide for this plugin with a bit more detail can be found here:

https://www.figma.com/proto/jwWFEWDI10CUk83d1r7Mcv/Plugin---Truncate-Lines?node-id=137%3A259&scaling=scale-down-width&page-id=137%3A258

plugins.name: Many Paster
plugins.description:
Many Paster allows you to insert a list of data into selected text layers individually.

This may be useful for tables or data of the same category.

HOW TO USE IT?

1. Select the desired text layers.
2. Run the extension
3. Copy the data from the Excel spreadsheet or from any other document to the input extension.
4. Click "Paste Data."

PRO TIP:
You can set "Ctrl"+"M" hotkey via system preferences in Mac to run the plug-in quickly. 
You can read more about setting the hotkeys in Figma here: https://hustle.bizongo.in/custom-shortcuts-for-figma-8c93f3bc9ca2

NOTE:
Use advanced settings to:
- Loop the insert if there are more layers than data you have;
- Ignore characters if necessary;
- Insert data in reverse order;
- If you want to copy the list of selected data to Many Paster, click the "Copy from Selection" button.

plugins.name: Select by Name
plugins.description:
Quickly select multiple layers by searching for parts of the layer name, complete names or regular expressions. It all happens within Figma's Quick Action bar. This is useful for editing multiple layers in one go, especially if they are deeply nested within component instances.


â¶ï¸ Watch a demo video by Joey Pearlman (thanks!)


You also get a neat list of automatic suggestions consisting of ...

  1. up to three recently used queries and
  2. most frequently found layer names in your current selection, filtered live by your query.


The little number in front of the suggestions shows how many layers match this query. The selection you end up with might differ from that number, because the preview counts both, matching parent layers and matching children layers. Your selection will only contain the matching parent layer in such cases.


Commands

  1. Select: Select layers with the help of an index of all layer names in the selection (or page).
  2. Select â­: Skip creating the index. Useful if working with huge sets of layers, where creating the layer name index can get slow.
  3. Subtract: Remove layers from the selection. Only affects the parent layers in the selection, not the children.


Modes

  1. Default: Select all layers that contain your query. Position within the name and case doesn't matter.
  2. "Complete and precise": Select only layers with exactly the name you select. This is case sensitive and white space also matters. Quotes mark these type of queries, no need to type the quotes, though.
  3. /Regular expression/: Select layers that match the regular expression that you enter as a parameter. Slashes mark these type of queries, no need to type them. Regular expressions show up as a suggestion when you use expressions like [0-9] or ^ in your query.


The plugin is inspired by Select Layers by Yuan Qing Lim, I've been an avid user of the "Select layers by name" function and saw an opportunity to make that workflow in particular a bit quicker and more powerful using the new parameters API and regular expressions.

accepted.name: Richard Bruskowski
accepted.description:
Freelance Designer â 
Visual design, digital products, hi-fi prototypes, design systems, brand design.

plugins.tagline: Select multiple layers by filtering layer names. See previews directly in the Quick Action Bar.

  2. "Complete and precise": Select only layers with exactly the name you select. This is case sensitive and white space also matters. Quotes mark these type of queries, no need to type the quotes, though.
  3. /Regular expression/: Select layers that match the regular expression that you enter as a parameter. Slashes mark these type of queries, no need to type them. Regular expressions show up as a suggestion when you use expressions like [0-9] or ^ in your query.


The plugin is inspired by Select Layers by Yuan Qing Lim, I've been an avid user of the "Select layers by name" function and saw an opportunity to make that workflow in particular a bit quicker and more powerful using the new parameters API and regular expressions.

plugins.name: RTLit
plugins.description:
"RTLit" is a Figma plugin that converts the Arabic/Persian/Urdu text into readable format as Figma currently does not support RTL languages.


Behind the scenes it reverses the characters and does some other things to turn RTL gobbledigook into readable text. It has its limitations (see Known Issues below).


## How To


1. Copy Arabic/Persian/Urdu text from the source i.e. a web browser or other design software such as Adobe Illustrator etc.

2. Paste it into the Figma Text Box. Make sure you have selected a font that supports Perso-Arabic letters.

3. Select Figma Text Box (You can select more than one at a time as well).

4. `Right Click > Plugins > RTLit`

5. Done.


> Make sure you retain the original text somewhere. If you transform the Figma Text Box, you will have to redo the steps mentioned above.


## Known Issues


1. LTR words such as numbers or english text if broken in two lines might create problems in formatting.

2. There might be more unknown issues feel free to report them here (https://github.com/ahmednooor/RTLit/issues). Behind the scenes, it reverses the characters sort of like it is mentioned here (https://help.figma.com/article/70-writing-in-other-languages) in "Use Right-To-Left (RTL) languages" section on forums.
